the Cut Team","custom:security":"This contract uses OpenZeppelin's ReentrancyGuard for security","details":"Generic escrow contract for managing deposits and payouts  This contract implements a flexible escrow system where: - Participants deposit a fixed amount of tokens - An oracle determines the final payouts based on results - Payouts are distributed according to basis points (10000 = 100%) - Oracle receives a fee for their services  Key Features: - Fixed deposit amounts per participant - Oracle-controlled payout distribution - Automatic fee collection for oracle - Expiry-based refund mechanism - Cancellation support - Gas-optimized participant management ","errors":{"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized reentrant cancelAndRefund().details: Only callable by the oracle in emergency situations  This function: - Refunds all participants their original deposit - Clears all participant tracking - Moves escrow to CANCELLED state  Requirements: - Caller must be the oracle - Escrow must be in OPEN or IN_PROGRESS state  Emits an {EscrowCancelled} event

closeDeposits().details: Only callable by the oracle when the escrow is ready to proceed  Requirements: - Caller must be the oracle - Escrow must be in OPEN state  Emits a {DepositsClosed} event

constructor.details: Validates all parameters and sets up the escrow

params._decimals: The number of decimal places for the payment token
params._depositAmount: The amount each participant must deposit
params._expiry: The timestamp when the escrow expires
params._oracle: The address of the oracle that controls the escrow
params._oracleFee: The oracle fee in basis points (max 10000 = 100%)  Requirements: - _depositAmount must be greater than 0 - _expiry must be in the future - _paymentToken must not be the zero address - _oracle must not be the zero address - _oracleFee must not exceed 10000 (100%)
params._paymentToken: The address of the payment token contract

deposit().details: Transfers tokens from participant to escrow and tracks participation  Requirements: - Escrow must be in OPEN state - Escrow must not be at maximum capacity - Participant must have approved sufficient token allowance  Emits an {EscrowDeposited} event

params._payoutBasisPoints: Array of basis points for each participant (10000 = 100%)  This function: - Calculates oracle fee from total deposits - Distributes remaining funds according to basis points - Transfers any remaining dust amounts to oracle  Requirements: - Caller must be the oracle - Escrow must be in IN_PROGRESS state - _payoutBasisPoints length must match participant count - Total basis points must equal 10000 (100%)  Emits a {PayoutsDistributed} event

expiredEscrowWithdraw().details: Can be called by any participant after the expiry timestamp  Requirements: - Participant must have deposited - Current timestamp must be after expiry  Emits an {ExpiredEscrowWithdraw} event

returns._0: The number of participants who have deposited

withdraw().details: Refunds the deposit amount and removes participant from tracking  Requirements: - Escrow must be in OPEN state - Participant must have deposited  Emits an {EscrowWithdrawn} event

MAX_PARTICIPANTS().notice: Maximum number of participants allowed (gas optimization for distribute function)

cancelAndRefund().notice: Cancels the escrow and refunds all participants

closeDeposits().notice: Closes deposits and moves escrow to IN_PROGRESS state

constructor.notice: Constructor initializes the escrow with configuration parameters

deposit().notice: Allows a participant to deposit the required amount into the escrow

expiredEscrowWithdraw().notice: Allows participants to withdraw their deposit after escrow expiry

getParticipantsCount().notice: Gets the current number of participants in the escrow

hasDeposited(address).notice: Mapping to track if an address has deposited

oracle().notice: Address of the oracle that controls payouts and escrow state

participantIndex(address).notice: Mapping to track participant index for O(1) removal

participants(uint256).notice: Array of all participants (for iteration and payout distribution)

paymentToken().notice: The payment token used for deposits and payouts

paymentTokenDecimals().notice: Decimal places of the payment token

totalInitialDeposits().notice: Total amount of initial deposits collected

withdraw().notice: Allows a participant to withdraw their deposit before the escrow proceeds
